item.title: Consumer prices rose at annual rate of 2.9% in August, as weekly jobless claims jump
item.description: The consumer price index was expected to increase 0.3% in August, according to the Dow Jones consensus estimate.

item.title: European Central Bank leaves rates unchanged as tariff fallout lingers
item.description: The ECB is grappling with global economic uncertainty, despite inflation in the euro zone hovering around the central bank's 2% target in recent month...

item.title: France’s economy faces a key risk beyond its political turmoil
item.description: The "Big Three" ratings agencies will update their verdicts on the country's creditworthiness starting Friday, amid huge political and economic uncert...

item.title: Trump’s pressure on Europe to slap 100% tariffs on India and China raises eyebrows
item.description: Europe is unlikely to acquiesce to the White House's request to slap high tariffs on its Asian counterparts.

item.title: 5 takeaways from the producer price inflation report with another key reading on tap
item.description: The producer price index, a gauge of costs at the wholesale level in the U.S. economy, posted an unexpected 0.1% decline in August.
